content:
Authorization workflows ensure that financial decisions align with team members' skills and experience. Use an authorization workflow to establish financial controls and route requests for approval to supervisors and managers.

New team members handle smaller claims, while senior team members handle complex and expensive ones. Configure limits on how much users can pay or approve for losses and expenses. With limits in place, your workflow can efficiently route financial approval requests to users with greater authority.

Pre-configured tools in Insurance give you a head start on a financial authorization workflow. A User Financial Authority user interface lets team leaders define transaction threshold amounts for their team members. Services run for claim financial transactions determine if a user is attempting to exceed their maximum threshold.

Status values govern financial authority processes, and workflows within Salesforce approval processes ensure team leaders don't exceed their own thresholds when approving financial transactions.

Configure payment processes to run the financial authority service, create your own approval process, and make sure default status values are used consistently across custom settings, flows, and services.

Example: Judith is a Claims Adjuster who can pay up to $400 for losses. If she attempts to pay more, a warning appears and an approval request is sent to her supervisor.

Pre-configured tools drive records through the financial authorization workflow by evaluating whether users have the authority to pay or approve amounts. These tools update status values in claims, claim coverages, and claim coverage payment details.
title: Authorization Workflows for Financial Decisions
